title: Live Updates: Israel Launches Intense Airstrikes on Hezbollah, Killing Hundreds in Lebanon
content: It was the deadliest day of Israeli attacks in Lebanon since at least 2006. More than a thousand were also injured, Lebanon’s health ministry said, without saying how many were civilians. The armed group Hezbollah sent rockets into northern Israel and vowed to keep attacking.
summary: It was the deadliest day of Israeli attacks in Lebanon since at least 2006. More than a thousand were also injured, Lebanon’s health ministry said, without saying how many were civilians. The armed group Hezbollah sent rockets into northern Israel and vowed to keep attacking.

title: Forced From Home by War, They Found Solace in Soccer
content: For dozens of women who fled Myanmar and settled in Thailand, soccer has become a refuge from both the troubles of daily life and conservative cultural norms.
summary: For dozens of women who fled Myanmar and settled in Thailand, soccer has become a refuge from both the troubles of daily life and conservative cultural norms.

title: As U.N. Meets, Pressure Mounts on Biden to Loosen Up on Arms for Ukraine

title: U.N. Meets Amid a Backdrop of Growing Chaos and Violence
content: Beginning Tuesday, world leaders will discuss three wars, climate change, rising sea levels and proposals to expand representation on the Security Council.

title: U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer, Bruised by Freebies Row, Needs a Reset at Conference

title: Tanzania Arrests Opposition Leaders Ahead of Planned Protest
content: The East African country’s leading opposition party said that its presidential candidate in the last election and its chairman were among dozens detained before a protest called to draw attention to the killing and abduction of government critics.

title: Ukraine Needs to Be Realistic About Goals in War With Russia, Czech President Says

title: A French Fair as Workers’ Paradise, Feting Cuisine, Music and Communism

title: In Germany, Scholz’s Party Ekes Out Win Over Far Right

title: Biden Works Against the Clock as Violence Escalates in the Middle East
